name: Minesweeper
description: I designed and built a Minesweeper game as my first project for General Assembly's Software Engineering Immersive (SEI) after three weeks learning HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The mine locations are generated randomly on the user's first click, and all assets were created with a pixel art tool I built with JavaScript for the same program.

name: Musicals API
description: This API was developed primarily to track and showcase upcoming musical performances in Washington, DC. I created it as my second project for General Assembly's Software Engineering Immersive. My DC Musicals project (https://adamhg2411.github.io/dc-musicals) pulls data from this API to display it in a more accessible format.

name: DC Musicals
description: I taught myself React to build this front-end for my Musicals API. The goal of the app is to provide information on upcoming musical performances in the Washington, DC Metro Area, including links for tickets, Wikipedia entries for each show, and a Spotify widget for their soundtracks.

name: AHG Portfolio
description: I built this website to showcase my work as a software engineer. It's been through several iterations, but after learning React and React Router, I decided I wanted to start over and build it out with client-side routing.

name: TRACKiT
description: I collaborated with a fellow developer in General Assembly's Software Engineering Immersive to build a full-stack app supporting event budgeting and planning. Users can add events to their profile and plan out the expenses for each event.
